title: Capri-Sun and Eddy Merckx?
content:
Capri-Sun and Eddy Merckx just unveiled a limited-edition Pévèle C all-road bike featuring a Capri-Sun livery. Sales of the project will go to a good cause…

Capri-Sun and the Belgian bicycle manufacturer Eddy Merckx are reigniting a nostalgic partnership that dates back to the 1980s. Merckx fans might recall the Capri-Sonne team from 1982. Now, 43 years later, both brands are teaming up once again, this time to offer a limited-edition bike with its sales going to a good cause.

This collaboration channels the power of sport to benefit children in need. Proceeds from the bike will go to the international organisation War Child that supports kids affected by war with education, protection, and psychological care, in regions like Ukraine, the Middle East, and Western Europe. All profits from these collaboration bikes will benefit the international organization. The bikes will be available for order from 16th May, launching on the International Day of Living Together in Peace.

The limited-edition bike is manufactured in Beringen, Belgium, and features a striking Capri-Sun design inspired by the brand’s iconic colors.

The Pévèle C all-road bike is priced at €5,575 and will be available for order from 16 May until the end of September via the official Eddy Merckx website. Complementing the bike, a new Capri-Sun cycling jersey will be available, a replica of the 1980s Capri-Sonne team kits adapted for today’s riders.
